title: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] If file is already opened in one editor, cannot open in another editor (should give error msg)
description: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] If file is already opened in one editor, cannot open in another editor (should give error msg)
OB: After opening a Java file in the workbench, if you right-click on the file and select 'Open With' -> 'System Editor', nothing happens. The workbench should display a warning message indicating that opening the file in another editor may result in overwriting changes and prompt the user to confirm if they want to continue. Alternatively, an error message should be displayed instructing the user to close all open files before attempting to open the file in another editor. It is believed that this behavior is intended to prevent external editing while the file is already opened in the workbench.
EB: When right-clicking on a Java file that is already open in the workbench and selecting 'Open With' -> 'System Editor', a warning message should be displayed, informing the user that opening the file in another editor may result in overwriting changes. The message should provide an option for the user to confirm if they want to continue. If there are any open files, an error message should be displayed, instructing the user to close all open files before attempting to open the file in another editor.
SR:
1. Ensure that a Windows editor is associated with Java files. If not, go to the file explorer, double click on any Java file, and select WordPad or Notepad as the default editor for all Java files.
2. In the Java Perspective, right-click on a Java file and select 'Open With' -> 'System Editor'.
3. Verify that a warning message is displayed, indicating that opening the file in another editor may result in overwriting changes. The message should provide an option for the user to confirm if they want to continue.
4. If there are any open files, verify that an error message is displayed, instructing the user to close all open files before attempting to open the file in another editor.
